body:
The idea of a political triangle is by no means new, and has been discussed in PCM and other communities for a while now, however so far I have not encountered any actual tests for it. Since I believe it to be superior to the economic vs social square, I have created one. It's a very simple quiz with only 12 questions, however currently the questions are subject to change, so *please* give your honest feedback.

Take the quiz here: https://crystalvulpine.github.io/PoliticalTriangle/quiz.html

I also encourage users to share their results here. If you do, I'll create a chart in about a week from now mapping the positions of Ruqqus users! Memes about it are also welcomed.

Someone please also post this to reddit on /r/politicalcompassmemes and /r/politicalcompass since the admins gigabanned me.
body_html:
The idea of a political triangle is by no means new, and has been discussed in PCM and other communities for a while now, however so far I have not encountered any actual tests for it. Since I believe it to be superior to the economic vs social square, I have created one. It's a very simple quiz with only 12 questions, however currently the questions are subject to change, so please give your honest feedback.

Take the quiz here: https://crystalvulpine.github.io/PoliticalTriangle/quiz.html

I also encourage users to share their results here. If you do, I'll create a chart in about a week from now mapping the positions of Ruqqus users! Memes about it are also welcomed.

Someone please also post this to reddit on /r/politicalcompassmemes and /r/politicalcompass since the admins gigabanned me.

title: I made a political triangle test

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
For those familiar with the political compass, the triangle is a similar model, but instead of dividing economic vs social stances, it compares the 3 different main philosophies: equality (left), hierarchy (right), and individualism (libertarian). This resolves a few issues with the square compass, such as inconsistencies regarding the meanings of libertarian and right wing.

I made a small quiz to determine your position. It can be taken here: https://crystalvulpine.github.io/PoliticalTriangle/quiz.html

I'll go first. Here's where I am:

![](https://i.imgur.com/LoxdpZY.png)

100% pure based libertarian ancap
body_html:
For those familiar with the political compass, the triangle is a similar model, but instead of dividing economic vs social stances, it compares the 3 different main philosophies: equality (left), hierarchy (right), and individualism (libertarian). This resolves a few issues with the square compass, such as inconsistencies regarding the meanings of libertarian and right wing.

I made a small quiz to determine your position. It can be taken here: https://crystalvulpine.github.io/PoliticalTriangle/quiz.html

I'll go first. Here's where I am:

100% pure based libertarian ancap

guild.description:
Ask and answer questions.

Rules:

🤔 Posts must be questions. This is a community dedicated to Q&A discussion, so post titles must be in the form of a question.

⁉️ No loaded questions.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

🥾 Breaking these rules will result in posts being kicked and possibly an exile.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

body:
https://github.com/CrystalVulpine/VoxelPlanet

It's just a github right now, no releases yet unfortunately. If you actually care that much to check it out you'll have to build it from source. There's a good reason for this, because right now it barely even works.

Note: This has nothing to do with the other Voxel Planet made about 5 years ago that actually made a spherical planet out of voxels.

title: Double blep

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

author.bio_html:

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
For now, the way you set a color is:

* R opens red for editing
* G opens green for editing
* B opens blue for editing
* After doing that, type in a value from 000-255 to set that color value!

There will be a square in the top right corner of the screen showing the current cube color.

A half baked solution, I know, but it'll have to do while I add more advanced GUI functionality.

Edit: Oh, almost forgot: The color code for porpl is R:128, G:90, B:213!
body_html:
For now, the way you set a color is:

  • R opens red for editing
  • G opens green for editing
  • B opens blue for editing
  • After doing that, type in a value from 000-255 to set that color value!

There will be a square in the top right corner of the screen showing the current cube color.

A half baked solution, I know, but it'll have to do while I add more advanced GUI functionality.

Edit: Oh, almost forgot: The color code for porpl is R:128, G:90, B:213!

body:
In the future you will be able to create mods/plugins for the game, simply by defining functions in a shared library and placing it in the mods folder! I already have one function working, but it can't do much. It's just a test at this point. There is documentation and an example mod on github if you want to check it out: https://github.com/CrystalVulpine/VoxelPlanet

The mod system is also only currently available for Linux. I plan to support it on multiple systems, however I can only build it for Linux and Windows. Someone else will have to make and test an API for Macs or anything else. It's not very complicated though, it basically just loads the mod functions from the DLLs it finds and calls them throughout the game.
body_html:
In the future you will be able to create mods/plugins for the game, simply by defining functions in a shared library and placing it in the mods folder! I already have one function working, but it can't do much. It's just a test at this point. There is documentation and an example mod on github if you want to check it out: https://github.com/CrystalVulpine/VoxelPlanet

The mod system is also only currently available for Linux. I plan to support it on multiple systems, however I can only build it for Linux and Windows. Someone else will have to make and test an API for Macs or anything else. It's not very complicated though, it basically just loads the mod functions from the DLLs it finds and calls them throughout the game.
